meanings.definition: Having many interrelated parts or facets; complex or complicated.
meanings.sent1: The puzzle was intricate, with many pieces that fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The artist created an intricate design using tiny brush strokes.
meanings.sent3: The detective's intricate plan to catch the thief involved hidden cameras and decoy jewelry.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an intricate maze, full of twists and turns.
meanings.sent5: The spider's web was so intricate that it sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: Difficult to understand, analyze, or solve.
meanings.sent1: The professor's lecture on quantum physics was intricate, leaving the students confused.
meanings.sent2: The legal case was so intricate that even the lawyers had trouble unraveling it.
meanings.sent3: Trying to assemble the intricate furniture without instructions was a comedy of errors.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like an intricate puzzle, challenging to piece together.
meanings.sent5: The ancient manuscript was written in an intricate code that took years to decipher.

meanings.sent1: The wedding cake was intricate, adorned with delicate sugar flowers.
meanings.sent2: The palace ceiling was a masterpiece of intricate carvings and paintings.
meanings.sent3: The costume designer's intricate outfits for the play stole the show.
meanings.sent4: Her jewelry box was a treasure trove of intricate necklaces and bracelets.
meanings.sent5: The tapestry depicted an intricate scene of knights in battle.
